body.name: TECKNET Wireless Mouse, 2.4G USB Computer Mouse with 6-Level Adjustable 3200 DPI, 30 Months Battery, Ergonomic Grips, 6 Buttons Portable for PC, Chromebook, Mac - Grey
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 1 hr 51 mins

features: 【6 Levels Adjustable DPI & 6 Buttons】TECKNET wireless mouse has a 6-Level adjustable DPI (800/1200/1600/2000/2400/3200), which provides more sensitivity than standard optical mice for smooth and precise tracking on a wide range of surfaces.

【30 Months Battery Life】Designed with the upgraded independent power switches and sleep modes to minimize battery consumption, the wireless mouse can enjoy up to 30 months of use time with only 2 AA batteries (not included). 2X longer battery life than others.

【Plug & Play 】The wireless mouse has a 50ft/15m wireless use range, which reduces interference and delay for you. No need to install any drivers, plug the TECKNET wireless mouse into the device and you are ready to go!

【Ergonomic Design & Comfort Grip】Featuring a streamlined curved design, this full-size wireless mouse has non-slip rubber sides, a palm rest and a sculpted design for unprecedented comfort. Product Dimension: 4.23*2.61*1.63 in.

【Wide Compatibility & Easy to Use】TECKNET mouse is long-lasting and versatile. This laptop mouse is easily compatible with Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 11/10/8/7, Vista 8/7, Chromebook, Mac OS Linux and other systems.
【Hassle-Free Customer Service】If you do not like our product or service, please feel free to contact us. Each TECKNET product provides a 36 months warranty (registered only).

productInformation.name: Special Feature
productInformation.value: Comfortable Design, TruWave Precision, CoLink For Anchored Pairing, 2.4G Wireless Gaming Technology, 30 Month-Long Battery Life, 8-million-click lifespan, Battery Level Indicator, Plug-and-Forget Nano Receiver,Back/Forward buttons See more

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Previous page Comfort Focused Ergonomic design reduced up to 35% wrist strain, providing all day comfort. Any-Surface Tracking The mouse could track on virtually any surface, such as paper, resin, cloth or even glass. Compatibility Compatible with Win XP, Win Vista, Win 11/10/8/7, Vista 8/7, Chromebook, Mac OS Linux and etc. Precise Responsiveness 6 DPI levels(800/1200/1600/2000/2400/3200) change the cursor sensitivity easily for your activity. Next page 1 Ergonomic Design 2 Anyplace to Use 3 Universal Compatibility 4 6-Level Adjustable DPI

Ultra-Durable Build Smooth Scroll Wheel Provide skin-friendly feel with silicone scroll and line-by-line precision. Extra Controls at Your Fingertips Allows you to browse the web and work faster and easier.

Energy-Saving Design The mouse will automatically go into sleep modes within 10s for longer battery life and wake up when you move. 30-Month Battery life Designed with the upgraded independent power switches and sleep modes to minimize battery consumption, the wireless mouse can enjoy up to 30 months of use time with only 2 AA batteries (not included).

How do I know what DPI setting I have this mouse on? TECKNET wireless mouse has a 6-Level adjustable DPI (800/1200/1600/2000/2400/3200) with DPI gear indicator, which indicates the current DPI gear speed by LED flash times (1/2/3/4/5/6 times). Is this a full-size mouse? Yes. Product Dimension: 4.23*2.61*1.63 in. Weight: 2.65 oz. Does this work well for Mac computers in general? Yes. The wireless mouse could function well in Mac OS except for the side buttons that cannot be used in Mac. I lost the mouse receiver, Can I get a unifying USB dongle? No. One USB receiver can only pair one wireless mouse in case of interference. Does it compatible with WIN 11 Pro? TECKNET wireless mouse is compatible with Windows 11 Pro, 11, 10, 8.1, 8, 7, XP, Vista, Linux, Surface, Chromebook and Mac OS (Side buttons are not available on Mac).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice, Robust, Cheap, Wireless Mouse
reviews.reviewText: For reference, I bought this mouse on November 28th, 2015 for $9.97. The current date that I'm writing this review is August 4th, 2017. The mouse is still intact and working as well as it had when I first bought it. You would expect a cheap mouse like this break after so much time, but it has maintained itself quite well. It helps a bit that this mouse is on the heftier side, the weight really helps. 2.65 ounces isn't much, but i had been using a dinkier mouse than this one. I have average sized hands, maybe smaller so take that snip-it with a grain of salt.When I bought it, it took some time for me to get used to it. Like any item, I took some time to break into the setup of the mouse. The clicks were a little heavy, but that changed after some weeks of use. The wheel is nice and smooth. Over the course of my usage, it hasn't broken, hasn't caught itself on its own parts. The middle mouse button STILL works splendidly. The click function still works, it doesn't take that much force to use. I do a fair amount of web browsing on top of gaming. This mouse works very well for both cases.The DPI switch was a nice addition to have in the beginning. Finding the right DPI to use in different scenarios and tasks, this mouse is a good start. Although throughout my own maturity I realized I didn't actually need very high DPI for most of my tasks, but to each their own. The circuitry and programming inside the mouse saves battery life quite well. When the mouse is not in use for more than 10 minutes at a time, it goes to sleep and conserves power. This eliminates the need to keep turning off the power to the mouse every time you stop using the mouse. It makes it easier to transport too. You can't awaken the mouse by moving it around, but instead by clicking the mouse buttons a couple times or rolling the mouse wheel. So a simple shuffle won't unnecessarily waste power. But if you are still inclined to turn off the switch per habit, again to each their own.The DPI switch acts as both, obviously a switch, but also as an indicator. Whenever the battery life gets low or whenever you need to start finding a fresh battery, the DPI light will start periodically flashing red. The mouse will still work even if the light is flashing, but by the time the light stops flashing while in use, the battery is dead. It runs on a simple AA battery, which will last you quite a while. In my usage, each battery through this mouse lasts me anywhere from 2-3 months. I game in my spare time, mind you. The sleep module works really well. Probably part of the reason this lasted as long as it did.The thumb/side buttons are not only comfortable but easy to use. You can't accidentally bump into the buttons to activate it, these buttons aren't that touchy. The thumb imprint works really well. It gives a relaxing position to keep my thumb under extended use. Speaking of comfortably, if you've ever looked at your hand in rest position (palm facing up), this mouse will cradle that position very well. It's not perfect, it is a medium sized mouse but it is contoured very well. The USB connector holds a very strong connection with the mouse. When you need to transport it, and not lose it by accident, it tucks nicely in the light-spring slot on the bottom of the mouse. It makes for very easy transportation.This is the only qualm and my only con about this mouse: the shape. I will not lie this mouse is shaped a little strange. By nature, human fingers vary in length, specifically speaking, the middle finger is longer than the index. The picture isn't lying; the right-click button which I typically use with my middle finger is shorter than the left click button which i use with my index. I had to adopt a claw position on my mouse (curved fingers into a more clicking position) to use this mouse as my middle finger kept going over the button. I still think that button should be longer, but again, that's my opinion.All in all, Good work, Tecknet.Edit: About a week after I wrote this review, then the mouse started giving me problems. Double clicking, Unregistered clicks, Under representing movements, etc. FML. On the plus side, this mouse did last 2 years.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The TECKNET Wireless Mouse has been a fantastic addition to my setup. Its ergonomic design fits comfortably in my hand, making long work sessions a breeze. The wireless connectivity is reliable, and the battery life is impressive. The precision and responsiveness of the mouse make it a joy to use for both work and casual browsing. Overall, a reliable and well-performing wireless mouse that I highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Have bought 2 now
reviews.reviewText: These work great and are comfortable to use by both my husband with average guy hands and me with small women's hands. Works fine on rechargable batteries (the smaller version did not). Love that they come in different colors so we can easily tell which computer it's paired with. Bought our first one years ago and the fact that it's still going makes us keep going back. SOOO much better than a corded mouse!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great mouse for the price paid
reviews.reviewText: For the price of under $10 for a wireless mouse, it's totally worth it. The mouse functions as it should without issue and fits my hands perfectly. It uses AA batteries so it will add a little weight to the mouse. I don't use it for gaming so I can't comment on it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Everything I Was Looking For In A Mouse!
reviews.reviewText: I love this mouse. I work a desk job and mouse size is very important top me. I have rather large hands so small mice can make my hand cramp up. This mouse is larger than normal (in my opinion). It is very similar in size to the Microsoft mouse that comes with a keyboard if that helps. Once the dongle was plugged in, it worked like a charm. No lag or delay. And the best part.......the clicking! There is NOOOOOOO sound when clicking! I love this as it is so irritating when mice are too loud. I'm very happy with this purchase!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice feel and best value
reviews.reviewText: All buttons are in the right place/space and your palm resting on the contouring design. I'm going to get another one for my MacBook.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It was everything I was looking for color matches my computer and works completely fine. I was just looking for a cheap but good working mouse for school. I dropped it a ton and it didn’t break it was build really sturdy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Work's well with you laptop computer. It feels good in your hand contours really nice. Just make sure you take the cover off to locate your USB port inside.
Great fit for my hand, comfortable !

reviews.reviewTitle: produit de qualité et tien à long terme
reviews.reviewText: La souris sans fil TeckNet Classic 2.4G est un excellent choix pour ceux qui cherchent une souris fiable et efficace. La connectivité 2.4G assure une connexion stable et rapide, sans aucun retard ou interruption. La conception ergonomique offre un confort de utilisation pour une utilisation prolongée. La précision de la souris optique est élevée et répond bien aux mouvements. Il est également facile à configurer, il suffit de brancher le récepteur USB fourni dans l'ordinateur et de l'allumer pour commencer à utiliser. En résumé, une souris sans fil de qualité à un prix abordable.

Semplicemente: ergonomico, ortopedico e termodinamico! No... non è uno scherzo, insisto su tutte e tre le proprietà e non esagero minimamente. Va provato per crederci! Ha le dimensioni di un mouse classico moderno (quindi niente mini-mouse o ultra-leggeri particolari). La mano letteralmente si distende e trova il suo "parcheggio" ideale su di esso (si addormenta oserei dire e il perché lo si scopre se continuerete a leggere la presente...). Ha un suo peso anche se non eccessivo (125 grammi esatti, batterie incluse sulla bilancia ma non nella confezione: 2 stilo AA, raccomandate le alkaline ovviamente). Dicevo: ha un suo peso... ma DEVE essere così altrimenti non controbilancia correttamente la velocità del puntatore (è proprio questa caratteristica che lo rende molto comodo e riposante per la mano che lo utilizza). Altri mouse eccessivamente leggeri o piccoli tendono a far muovere di più (o a portare a regolare la velocità del puntatore dalle impostazioni) con tremila zig zag inutili e senza senso (a meno che non andiate a TeraHertz sensoriali... ;D). Tutto ciò determina una precisione impressionante con pochissimo sforzo (relativamente alla classe di prodotto ovviamente). La forma del mouse la trovo ortopedica in quanto sembra perfetta per un utilizzo elevato di ore e ore (in aggiunta alla precisione disponibile per quanto su detto). Ma la vera chicca secondo me... è costituita dal fatto che il materiale plastico di cui è fatto deve essere speciale: in particolare la zona superiore è ultra-lucida/riflettente e pare proprio assorbire il calore della mano ossia pare scaldarsi... allineandosi/regolandosi con la temperatura della mano. Questa proprietà non l'ho mai riscontrata con nessun altro mouse plastico (tra quelli economici che ho potuto provare). Tale caratteristica regala di conseguenza una sensazione unica come se il mouse cioé smettesse di essere un corpo estraneo ma divenisse un tutt'uno con la mano. Unita alle altre proprietà su descritte rende il prodotto per me davvero eccezionale. Inoltre scivola alla grande sul tappetino (consigliati quelli in tessuto), ha l'interruttore acceso/spento per il risparmio energetico quando si prevede di non utilizzarlo per lungo tempo, la rotellina non perde un colpo come i tasti d'altronde e nota bene: i 2 tastini laterali a sinistra sono rialzati quel tanto che basta per evitare click accidentali col pollice. In più aggiungete tutte le caratteristiche indicate sulla scheda prodotto, come la regolazione dei DPI, su cui non ho ancora trovato nulla da ridire (qualora aggiornerò tale mia recensione). Allo stato attuale pertanto e in conclusione: straconsigliato nella categoria dei mouse classici wireless USB per il prezzo irrisorio tra l'altro a cui attualmente viene proposto (sotto i 25 euro).

reviews.reviewTitle: Prezzo onesto, Ergonomico, Funzioni essenziali presenti - Perfetto per chi ha MANI GRANDI.
reviews.reviewText: L'ho preso 2 anni fa a mio padre (BLU SCURO). Avendo le mani grandi ed un inizio di artrite alle mani si è trovato bene dal punto di vista ergonomico.Ora ne ho preso uno pure a mia madre (VIOLA).Ha tutte le funzioni necessarie all'utente medio e con qualche cosa in più .Grip confortevole. Preciso e versatile (scuola-casa-ufficio).NON ADATTO a giocatori ACCANITI ma si può giocare tranquillamente .In quest'ultimo caso consiglierei di tenerlo come mouse di RISERVA.Il connettore USB praticamente una volta inserito lo si dimentica perchè a differenza di altri mouse non è invasivo, permettendo così di spostare il pc senza rischiare di rimanere impigliato.E' abbastanza robusto e lievi cadute non l'hanno danneggiato.Funzione BATTERY SLEEP utilissima. In 2 anni non si è ancora scaricato (Uso ufficio - casa)Utilizzato su un desktop di 15 anni fa con WINDOWS XP, più desktop con WIN 10 , diversi laptop WIN 7 - 10 (HP G4-G6-pavilion-Omen, ASUS, ACER) ma non ho mai riscontrato nessun tipo di problema.Le batterie NON SONO INCLUSE. Fossi in loro lo scriverei a caratteri cubitali perchè uno non ci pensa mai.
